top_code:
import Mathlib
universe u v w u_1 u_2 u_3 u₁ u₂ u₃
set_option maxHeartbeats 10000000
set_option linter.unreachableTactic false
lean_code:
theorem int.DivisibleBy12DivisibleBy3 : ∀ (n : ℤ), 12 ∣ n → 3 ∣ n :=
    by
    have assert_3632913198885782682 : ∀ (n : ℤ), 12 ∣ n → ∃ (q : ℤ), n = 12 * q :=
      by
      intro n a
      exact a
    have assert_6576307394875319956 : ∀ {n q : ℤ}, n % 12 = 0 → n = 12 * q → n = 3 * (4 * q) :=
      by
      intro n q a a_1
      subst a_1
      simp_all only [Int.mul_emod_right]
      sorry
    let k : ℤ := 4 * q
    have assert_976945250916087522 : ∀ (n q k : ℤ), n % 12 = 0 → n = 12 * q → k = 4 * q → n = 3 * k := by sorry
    have : ∀ (n : ℤ), (∃ (q : ℤ), n = 12 * q) → ∃ (k : ℤ), n = 3 * k := by sorry
    (expose_names;
      exact fun n a =>
        h n (assert_3632913198885782682 n (assert_3632913198885782682 n (assert_3632913198885782682 n a))))
    intro n a
    (omega)

proof_steps.text: The statement "integer x is divisible by integer y" is equivalent to "there must exist an integer q such that x = y * q".

items.claim: n is divisible by 3, since there exists an integer k such that n = 3 * k.

document.label: thm:divisibility_by_12_implies_3
document.claim: If an integer is divisible by 12, then it is divisible by 3.
